questions.question: Is there any difference between the following two statements? char *p=0; char *t=NULL;
questions.answerDescription: NULL is #defined as 0 in the 'stdio.h' file. Thus, both p and t are NULL pointers.

questions.question: Is this a correct way for NULL pointer assignment? int i=0; char *q=(char*)i;
questions.answerDescription: The correct way is char *q=0 (or) char *q=(char*)0

questions.question: Will the program compile in Turbo C?
questions.answerDescription: Error in statement k++. We cannot perform arithmetic on void pointers. The following error will be displayed while compiling above program in TurboC. Compiling PROGRAM.C: Error PROGRAM.C 8: Size of the type is unknown or zero.
